title: Anyone know how the Honor system works?
body:
Disclaimer/ish :I play a decent amount of games a day. Maybe at best 3 hours a day or more.

So I've been Honor 2 with *1 out of 3* checkpoint for a while now. I accumulate roughly 1-3 honors a game on average. I'm not toxic nor have I gotten reported/punished, hence still Honor 2.

I've had over 200+ honors the past couple of weeks. 

How do you know you're about to hit checkpoint 2 or is there a requirement to hit checkpoint 2? Say getting over 300 honors?

replies.body:
It is secret to prevent people gaming the system, but it seems to require a certain average number of honors per game to advance, and a lack of dishonorable behavior - the system keeps track of validated reports even if what was found was not enough for punishment or warning. Stuff like AFKing probably hurts it as well.

I was honor 2 for about a year and then suddenly got two checkpoints in the last couple weeks with no real change to my honors received, though.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jB2E3x6t,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-07-09T03:17:21.392+0000)

> It is secret to prevent people gaming the system, but it seems to require a certain average number of honors per game to advance, and a lack of dishonorable behavior - the system keeps track of validated reports even if what was found was not enough for punishment or warning. Stuff like AFKing probably hurts it as well.
> 
> I was honor 2 for about a year and then suddenly got two checkpoints in the last couple weeks with no real change to my honors received, though.

See... I can't spend 24/7 on this game to get Honor 5 with 15 checkpoints I have to go through. Even if I manage at minimum 2 honors a game, 10 games a day, 7 days a week, 365.25 days a year. I don't think I will be able to hit Honor 5.

Last season I got Honor 4 but that's after like 1000 games with maybe 2-3 honors average.

Now it feels impossible unless I live League, which I don't want to. I mean sure, it makes sense to play more, you get more in return but I simply can't put in as much effort as I did last year due to conflict in life schedule.

I wish the checkpoint were more like a progression bar, that the "honors" you receive from team mates would add to that progression bar. If you get honorable in a game it boosts even more, etc etc. 

I don't know where I am with the checkpoints. Stage 1 of 3, I've been on this for over the past 6 months :P I feel better if I would be able to see the progression as oppose to a vague, you are here.

If it's not a grind method, the average should have gotten me at least honor 3 by now. I honestly don't think it's average. I am sure the new honor system is more complicated *(like how most updates since season 4)* and or probably requires you to obtain certain honors within a time frame.
